ygData.subject: Re: Macro setup for bards
ygData.msgSnippet: I think most of you know this, but keep in mind that there are a lot of situations in which where you stand when you are camping seens to directly affect the
ygData.messageBody:
I think most of you know this, but keep in mind that there are a lot of
situations in which where you stand when you are camping seens to directly
affect the spawn rates of the creatures you are camping for. I have seen
that if you stand to close to a spawn spot a monster often does not seem to
spawn for a long time. Also, I have a paladin friend who has been camping a
popular SK in befallen and when he leaves the room it spawns every few
mintutes, but if someone is standing in the room it spawns in it takes
significantly longer to reappear.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Adam DeMarino [mailto:psycotix@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, June 02, 1999 5:51 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Macro setup for bards
>
>
> From: Adam DeMarino <psycotix@...>
>
> Though is has nothing to do with the macro setup, I'll discuss the
> friendly gnoll Grenix. He does anything but spawn regularly. He know
> longer follows the 6 hour schedule, and at times he won't spawn for 12
> or so hours, and then 3 times the next hour. I've sat around,
> watch many
> fights(lost too many of them to nukers and high level
> people), and I can
> safely say there is no pattern. Even the captain formula(don't ask)
> doesn't work anymore. Getting one of these is pure luck. And
> yes, it is
> strange they spawn there. Too bad the captain is blind heh...
>
> Talonus
> Traveling Bard of Solusek Ro
>
